snippet: A woman in a camp for Rohingya was forced to weigh what her son should sacrifice for her to save her husband’s life.
abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column describes desperation that drove Jano Begum and Robi Alom, Muslims of Rohingya minority in Myanmar, to try and flee to Malaysia; notes Rohingya have been confined in concentration camps and isolated villages since 2012, and have been subjected to ethnic cleansing that may amount to genocide; laments Rohingya plight has been met by global indifference.
lead_paragraph: A woman in a camp for Rohingya was forced to weigh what her son should sacrifice for her to save her husband’s life.

headline.main: In Myanmar, a Wife’s Wrenching Decision
